cab.content: (This Document is the Property of His Britannic Majesty^ "Government.)Circulated by the Secretary of" State for India.From Viceroy, Foreign Department, 21st January 1918. (Received at 11.50 p.m.)Secret. Weekly report. North-West Frontier quiet! Pacification of Chins proceeding satisfactorily. Kukis attacked Military Police under Sub-Divisional Officer, Homalin, inflicting several casualties. Burma and Assam hope to be able to. deal with situation with Military Police.Recruiting ligures for December 1917 as follows : Fighting men, 22,151; Mechanical Transport drivers, 345; Muleteers, 3,273; non-combatants, 12,610.General military situation unchanged.
